document_name_accent: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json
document_title: Cervical cancer stage I (early stage): Symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Disease stage reflects the degree of tumor development and metastasis. Determining the stage helps doctors make decisions about choosing the most optimal treatment methods for the patient.
The International Federation of Obstetrics and Gynecology (FIGO) classification system is often used in staging cervical cancer, including 4 stages denoted by Roman numerals from I to IV. (first)
Stage I cervical cancer (IA and IB) is diagnosed when the disease is limited to the cervix and has not spread to surrounding tissues or other organs.
Stage I cervical cancer has a good prognosis and highly effective treatment.
subsection_title: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json. What is stage I cervical cancer?
subsection_data:
